parent.title: Parent WO
parent.remarks: Parent of the work order shown in the Work Order field. When this field is blank, the work order in the Work Order field is a top-level work order. To assign a work order to a parent, select Assign to New Parent from the Select Action menu.

aos.title: Requires Asset Downtime
aos.remarks: Indicates that the work cannot be performed while the asset is operating.

estservcost.title: Estimated Service Cost
estservcost.remarks: Total estimated service cost against this work order.

pluscfrequency.title: Frequency Field
pluscfrequency.remarks: Number of time units (days, weeks, months, or years) to elapse between work orders you generate from this PM. The count begins at the value in the Last Target Start Date (if Use Target Start? is selected or Last Completion Date (if Use Target Start? is not the selected field. This value may differ differ from the Regulatory Frequency to facilitate scheduling. For example, a regulatory frequency of 31 days may have a frequency of 28 days.

ownergroup.title: Owner Group
ownergroup.remarks: The group currently responsible for the work order.

assetlocpriority.title: Asset/Location Priority
assetlocpriority.remarks: Identifies the priority level copied from the asset or location record and used to schedule the work order. Values from 0-999 are valid, but we recommend limiting your range of values to 0-9, where 0 designates the lowest priority. We also recommend assigning priority values only to locations. Entering a value will update the CalcPriority field according to the calculation option in the PriCalc table. MAXIMO uses this value to update the Respond By date.

calcshift.title: Shift
calcshift.remarks: Along with the calculation calendar, sets the business hours that calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Select Value button to choose a shift.

workpackmtlstatus.title: Work Package Material Status
workpackmtlstatus.remarks: The availability status of all materials on the current work order and related child records. The status is determined by the planned materials on a work order. The completion of the child records does not always determine the overall status of the materials in the work package.

istask.title: Is Task
istask.remarks: Specifies whether the work order is a task. If the check box is selected, the work order is a task. If the check box is cleared, the work order is not a task.

estatapprmatcost.title: Estimate Material Cost at Approval
estatapprmatcost.remarks: Cost estimate of the work order's material at the time the work order was approved.

flowaction.title: Flow Action
flowaction.remarks: The action to be performed (if any) when the workorder is started via process flow control

pcpchangeby.title: Physical percent complete - Who last changed
pcpchangeby.remarks: Physical percent complete - Who last changed

wopriority.title: Priority
wopriority.remarks: Identifies the importance of the work order, from 0-999, where 0 is the lowest priority and 999 is the highest.

pluscloop.title: Loop Calibration
pluscloop.remarks: Select this check box to identify the work order as a loop calibration. May be selected when a value is entered in the Location field.

fnlconstraint.title: Finish No Later Than
fnlconstraint.remarks: The date that work should be completed by.  Scheduled dates should be before this date.

nestedjpinprocess.title: Nested Job Plan Processing
nestedjpinprocess.remarks: Record will be locked while the jobplan containing nested jobplans is in the process of being applied to the record.

estatapprtoolcost.title: Estimate Tool Cost at Approval
estatapprtoolcost.remarks: Cost estimate of the work order's tools at the time the work order was approved.

hasfollowupwork.title: Has Follow-up Work
hasfollowupwork.remarks: Specifies whether the work order has follow up work. If the check box is selected, there is follow up work. If the check box is cleared (the default), there is no follow up work.

pmnum.title: PM
pmnum.remarks: Identifies the preventive maintenance record from which the work order was generated.

flowactionassist.title: Flow Action Assist
flowactionassist.remarks: Suppresses the automatic firing of the action in flow control

ignorediavail.title: Ignore Direct Issue Availability For Work Order Status
ignorediavail.remarks: Indicates whether to ignore the availability of direct issues for the work order status approval.

pcacthrs.title: Percent complete by actual hours
pcacthrs.remarks: Specifies the percent complete as calculated by actual hours vs. planned hours.

amcrew.title: Crew
amcrew.remarks: Defines the Crew who will be copied to the work order created with this job plan.

pointnum.title: Measurement Point
pointnum.remarks: The point number on the asset from which the measurement is taken.

commodity.title: Service
commodity.remarks: Defines the service for the work order, for example: customer support, painting, print, telecommunications, and welding.

pluscfrequnit.title: Frequency Unit
pluscfrequnit.remarks: Defines the time units (days, weeks, months, or years) for the Frequency field on time-based PMs.

assignedownergroup.title: Assigned Owner Group
assignedownergroup.remarks: Assigned Owner Group of the workorder record. This group has overall responsibility for the solution. Use the Select Action menu to assign an owner group. You can enter a value either in this field or the Owner field.

pluscoverduedate.title: Calibration Overdue Date
pluscoverduedate.remarks: Displays the over due date for the calibration, if the work order is not completed.

pmextdate.title: PM Extension Date
pmextdate.remarks: From the Extended Date of the PM

estoutlabcost.title: Estimated Cost of External Labor
estoutlabcost.remarks: The estimated hours of external labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

vendor.title: Vendor
vendor.remarks: Identifies the vendor responsible for the work.

crewworkgroup.title: Crew Work Group
crewworkgroup.remarks: Resource pool that will perform the work order.

estdur.title: Duration
estdur.remarks: Estimated remaining number of hours needed to complete the work.

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.remarks: Calendar to determine shift work is to be done on

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Work Order Description

estatapprintlabhrs.title: Estiamted Hours of Internal Labor
estatapprintlabhrs.remarks: The hours of internal labor for the task on the current work order at the time it was approved.

statusdate.title: Status Date
statusdate.remarks: Date the work order status was last changed.

repairfacility.title: Repair Facility
repairfacility.remarks: Specifies the repair facility location. A repair facility can take ownership of work orders from multiple sites in the same organization. User security can be configured to give permission to view work orders in multiple sites if the work orders are owned by a single repair facility.

estatapprlabhrs.title: Estimate Labor Hours at Approval
estatapprlabhrs.remarks: Estimate of the work order's labor hours at the time the work order was approved.

respondby.title: Respond By
respondby.remarks: A Calculated field specifying when by a breakdown should be responded to.

estatapprlabcost.title: Estimate Labor Cost at Approval
estatapprlabcost.remarks: Cost estimate of the work order's labor at the time the work order was approved.

lastcopylinkdate.title: Last Time doclinks Copied
lastcopylinkdate.remarks: The date time doclinks was copied from other related objects like asset,location,jobplan,safetyplan etc.

worklocation.title: Work Location
worklocation.remarks: Identifier of the Work Location that is to be responsible for the work.

suspendflow.title: Suspend Flow Control
suspendflow.remarks: Flag used to suspend and resume flow control on a parent record.  Rolls down the hierarchy to all its child records.

actintlabhrs.title: Actual Hours of Internal Labor
actintlabhrs.remarks: The hours of internal labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

targetdesc.title: Target Description
targetdesc.remarks: Temporary target description for targeting CIs

chargestore.title: Charge to Store
chargestore.remarks: Check box that Indicates whether charges on the work order should be added to the asset record. If the check box is selected, the charges will be added to the asset; if the check box is cleared, the charges will not be added to the asset. If the asset on the work order is a non-capitalized rotating asset not located in an operating location or a storeroom, Maximo selects the check box; otherwise this check box is cleared.

schedfinish.title: Scheduled Finish
schedfinish.remarks: Date and time the work is scheduled to be completed.

justifypriority.title: Priority Justification
justifypriority.remarks: Describes why the work order received the priority it has been assigned. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

inctasksinsched.title: Include Tasks in Schedule
inctasksinsched.remarks: Indicates that this work order's tasks will be included in the schedule view.

flowcontrolled.title: Under Flow Control
flowcontrolled.remarks: Flag used to indicate a records participation in flow control.  When applied to a parent, it rolls down the hierarchy to all its child records.

storeroommtlstatus.title: Storeroom Material Status
storeroommtlstatus.remarks: The availability status of storeroom materials on the current work order.

actstart.title: Actual Start
actstart.remarks: Date and time the actual work begain.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the work order. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

estatapproutlabcost.title: Estiamted Hours of External Labor
estatapproutlabcost.remarks: The cost of external labor for the task on the current work order at the time it was approved.

djpapplied.title: Dynamic Job Plan applied
djpapplied.remarks: This flag can be set to YES, NO, ERROR

sneconstraint.title: Start No Earlier Than
sneconstraint.remarks: The earliest date at which work should start.  Scheduled dates should be after this date.

estoutlabhrs.title: Estimated Hours of External Labor
estoutlabhrs.remarks: The estimated hours of external labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

wosequence.title: Sequence
wosequence.remarks: Indicates sequence in which to execute the work orders in a work order hierarchy.

actintlabcost.title: Actual Cost of Internal Labor
actintlabcost.remarks: The cost of internal labor for the task on the current work order.

owner.title: Owner
owner.remarks: The person currently responsible for the work order.

calcorgid.title: Organization
calcorgid.remarks: Organization associated with the calculation calendar, and used with the Calendar and Shift fields to calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Detail Menu button to select an organization or go to the Organizations application to create one.

environment.title: Environment
environment.remarks: This field defines the environment in which the change is taking place.

statusiface.title: Has Status Changed
statusiface.remarks: Non persistent boolean field to indicate whether the status has been changed after the stateful object is fetched from the database.

wogroup.title: WO Group
wogroup.remarks: This column is used to enhance performance of the Work Orders app.

schedstart.title: Scheduled Start
schedstart.remarks: Date and time the work is scheduled to begin.

location.title: Location
location.remarks: Identifies the work order's location. This is not necessarily the asset's location, however, if an asset is entered, its location will default here

risk.title: Risk Assessment
risk.remarks: Defines the risk level of the work order. Risk may be a numeric value or a term such as High, Medium, Low, or some other value based upon your business definitions.

haschildren.title: Has Children
haschildren.remarks: Y if WO has children N if it has no children

apptrequired.title: Appointment Required
apptrequired.remarks: Indicates if an appointment is required for the work order. Tasks that are created for this work order inherit this value, but can be modified.

historyflag.title: History
historyflag.remarks: Yes/No field or check box that specifies whether a record is a history record or is currently active. History records are complete, closed, canceled, etc. If a Y is in the History? field or the check box is selected, the record is a history record. On the List tab or the More Search Fields dialog box, you can enter a Y in the History? field to include only history records in the search results. If an N is in the field, Maximo includes only currently active records in the search results. If the field is empty (null), Maximo includes history and active records in the search results.

pluscnextdate.title: Next Calibration Due Date
pluscnextdate.remarks: Date the next work order is scheduled to be generated from the PM. The Next Due Date field is NULL unless there is an integer value in the Frequency field.

parentchgsstatus.title: Inherit Status Changes
parentchgsstatus.remarks: Specifies whether the work order's status will change when its parent work order's status changes. If the check box is selected (the default), the work order's status will change when the parent work order's status changes. If the check box is cleared, the work order's status will not change when the parent work order's status changes.

lms.title: Requires Location Maintenance Window
lms.remarks: Indicates that the work must be performed during a dedicated maintenance window.

genforpolineid.title: PO Line ID
genforpolineid.remarks: POLINEID number that required the work

pmduedate.title: PM Due Date
pmduedate.remarks: From the original Next Due Date of the PM

contract.title: Contract
contract.remarks: Identifies the warranty contract for the asset.

pctaskcomp.title: Percent complete by tasks completed
pctaskcomp.remarks: Specifies the percent complete as calculated by tasks completed vs. planned.

intshift.title: Interruptible shift
intshift.remarks: Specifies the shift on which the work will be interrupted in the Graphical Scheduling application.

phone.title: Phone
phone.remarks: The phone number (usually a work site telephone number) associated with the work order. If the Reported By person has a phone number associated with it, that phone number is the default for this field.

actservcost.title: Actual Service Cost
actservcost.remarks: Total actual service cost against this work order.

reqasstdwntime.title: Require Asset Downtime
reqasstdwntime.remarks: Indicates if the asset requires downtime while work is performed.

targcompdate.title: Target Finish
targcompdate.remarks: Date the work order is targeted to be completed.

origrecordclass.title: Originating Record Class
origrecordclass.remarks: Originating record's class, for example: change, release, incident, problem, or work order.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Status of the work order, for example, in progress, waiting on material, waiting for approval, completed, or closed.

pcphys.title: Physical percent complete
pcphys.remarks: Specifies the user-defined percent complete as entered manually.

commoditygroup.title: Service Group
commoditygroup.remarks: Defines the service group for the work order, for example: IT, production, facility, or fleet.

problemcode.title: Problem Code
problemcode.remarks: The problem being reported based on the defined Failure Class. This is usually the code in the second level of the failure reporting hierarchy.

reportedby.title: Reported By
reportedby.remarks: Identifies the person reporting the work order.

los.title: Requires Location Downtime
los.remarks: Indicates that the work must be performed when the location is not in use, and available for maintenance.

reasonforchange.title: Reason for Change
reasonforchange.remarks: Describes the reason for the change. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

pluscjprevnum.title: Job Plan Revision Number
pluscjprevnum.remarks: Displays the revision number of the Job Plan the work order was generated with.

persongroup.title: Work Group
persongroup.remarks: Identifies the person group responsible for the work. Person groups are set up in the Person Groups application.

crewid.title: Crew
crewid.remarks: ID for a given crew within an craft

onbehalfof.title: On Behalf Of
onbehalfof.remarks: Identifies for whom this work order has been created. For example, if someone did not have access to a computer, another user could create the work order on behalf of that person.

observation.title: Observation
observation.remarks: Describes the visual inspection data for this operation. If the work order has an associated work plan, Maximo copies this information from the Plans tab. You can edit this field until the work order is closed.

interruptible.title: Interruptible
interruptible.remarks: Specifies whether the work order is allowed to be stopped once the work has begun and then restarted. If the check box is selected, the work can be stopped. If the check box is cleared, the work cannot be stopped and restarted.

remdur.title: Time Remaining
remdur.remarks: Indicates the number of remaining hours needed to complete the work. You can modify this value until the work order is closed.

lead.title: Lead
lead.remarks: Lead person responsible for the work.

downtime.title: Downtime
downtime.remarks: Does the Asset have to be down for this work order?

whomischangefor.title: Whom is this change for
whomischangefor.remarks: Identifies whom a change is for.

np_statusmemo.title: Change Status Memo
np_statusmemo.remarks: Status change memo, temporary non-persistent field used by MEA

actoutlabcost.title: Actual Cost of External Labor
actoutlabcost.remarks: The cost of external labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

estatapprservcost.title: Estimate Service Cost at Approval
estatapprservcost.remarks: Cost estimate of the work order's services when the work order is approved.

ignoresrmavail.title: Ignore Storeroom Availability For Work Order Status
ignoresrmavail.remarks: Indicates whether to ignore the availability of items in the storeroom for the work order status approval.

origrecordid.title: Originating Record
origrecordid.remarks: Identifies the source record that was used to create this record.

estatapproutlabhrs.title: Estiamted Cost of External Labor
estatapproutlabhrs.remarks: The hours of internal labor for the task on the current work order at the time it was approved.

estatapprintlabcost.title: Approved Cost of Internal Labor
estatapprintlabcost.remarks: The cost of internal labor for the task on the current work order at the time it was approved.

firstapprstatus.title: First Approve Status
firstapprstatus.remarks: Identifies the first status change which approved the work order. This value is used to determine if the work order record has ever been approved. Work orders that have been approved are not allowed to be deleted.

pmnextduedate.title: PM Next Due Date
pmnextduedate.remarks: From the next Next Due Date of the PM

verification.title: Verification
verification.remarks: Used to verify that the Change was successful or describe how to determine if the Change was successful

woisswap.title: Is this an Asset Swap
woisswap.remarks: Identifies if the Move is a Move or a Swap

woacceptscharges.title: Accepts Charges
woacceptscharges.remarks: Check box specifies whether or not the work order accepts charges. If the check box is selected (the default), the work order accepts charges. If the check box is cleared, the work order does not accept charges, and you cannot enter charges on the work order.

repairlocflag.title: Repair Facility Required
repairlocflag.remarks: Indicates whether the repair location is required.

changedate.title: Changed Date
changedate.remarks: Date the work order was last modified.

djperror.title: Calculation error
djperror.remarks: The error message when trying to apply the dynamic job plan

backoutplan.title: Back Out Plan
backoutplan.remarks: Describes the back out plan in the event the change needs to be reversed.

actoutlabhrs.title: Actual Hours of External Labor
actoutlabhrs.remarks: The hours of external labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

supervisor.title: Supervisor
supervisor.remarks: Supervisor of the work. Maximo copies this information from the job plan, if there is one. You also can select a supervisor.

calccalendar.title: Calendar
calccalendar.remarks: Business days and times used to calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Detail Menu to select a calendar or go to the Calendars application to create one.

targstartdate.title: Target Start
targstartdate.remarks: Date the work order is targeted to begin. If the work order is generated from a PM, the date is supplied by the PM work order generation process.

ams.title: Requires Asset Maintenance Window
ams.remarks: Indicates that the work must be performed during a dedicated maintenance window.

reportdate.title: Reported Date
reportdate.remarks: The date and time the work order was reported.

newchildclass.title: New Child Class
newchildclass.remarks: Identifies the child work order class.

measuredate.title: Measurement Date
measuredate.remarks: Date/Time when measurement was taken or when observation was taken. This field becomes read-only when you enter a measurement and save the record.

availstatusdate.title: Material Status Last Updated
availstatusdate.remarks: The date and time that the material status was last updated.

worktype.title: Work Type
worktype.remarks: Identifies the work order's type. Some example types are: preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, emergency maintenace, capital project, and event report.

estintlabhrs.title: Estimated Hours of Internal Labor
estintlabhrs.remarks: The estimated hours of internal labor that are required for the task on the current work order.

inspector.title: Inspector
inspector.remarks: Identifies the inspector assigned to the work order

genforporevision.title: PO Revision
genforporevision.remarks: Revision number of the purchase order. Indicates how many times a purchase order has been revised.

glaccount.title: GL Account
glaccount.remarks: General ledger account code to which work order costs are charged. The GL account consists of up to four components: cost center, activity, resource, and element, each separated by a hyphen. If the work order was generated from a PM, Maximo copies the GL account from the PM. This field is read-only if the Charge to Store? check box is selected.

pcpchangedate.title: Physical percent complete - When last changed
pcpchangedate.remarks: Physical percent complete - When last changed

failurecode.title: Failure Class
failurecode.remarks: Failure class of the defined work asset. The failure class is the top level of the failure hierarchy.

milestone.title: Is Milestone
milestone.remarks: Indicates if this Work Order is a milestone.

dirissuemtlstatus.title: Direct Issue Material Status
dirissuemtlstatus.remarks: The availability status of direct issue materials on the current work order.

pluscphyloc.title: Physical Location
pluscphyloc.remarks: Enter a detailed description of the location of the asset or specify the location information using a hierarchy that you created. Using a hierarchy provides consistent identification and groups assets efficiently.

actfinish.title: Actual Finish
actfinish.remarks: Date and time the actual work was completed.

estintlabcost.title: Estimated Cost of Internal Labor
estintlabcost.remarks: The estimated cost of internal labor for the task on the current work order.

inspformnum.title: Inspection Form
inspformnum.remarks: The number of the inspection form.

repfacsiteid.title: Repair Facility Site
repfacsiteid.remarks: The site for the repair facility.
